docs.snippet: Oklahoma's prison system doesn't have all of the drugs necessary to carry out an execution set for this week, the state attorney general said Monday, and it hasn't met the conditions under law that would allow a switch to electrocution or firing s...
docs.lead_paragraph: Oklahoma's prison system doesn't have all of the drugs necessary to carry out an execution set for this week, the state attorney general said Monday, and it hasn't met the conditions under law that would allow a switch to electrocution or firing squad.

headline.main: Okla. Lawyers: Drugs Not Available for Execution

docs.snippet: Americans of all ages still pay heed to serious news even as they seek out the lighter stuff, choosing their own way across a media landscape that no longer relies on front pages and evening newscasts to dictate what's worth knowing, according to ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Americans of all ages still pay heed to serious news even as they seek out the lighter stuff, choosing their own way across a media landscape that no longer relies on front pages and evening newscasts to dictate what's worth knowing, according to a new study from the Media Insight Project.

headline.main: On the Media Buffet, People Still Seek Meaty News
headline.print_headline: On the Media Buffet, People Still Seek Meaty News

docs.snippet: Every morning, more than 100 heroin and opium addicts descend on the graveyard in this northeastern Myanmar village to get high. When authorities show up, it's for their own quick fix: Soldiers and police roll up the sleeves of their dark green un...
docs.lead_paragraph: Every morning, more than 100 heroin and opium addicts descend on the graveyard in this northeastern Myanmar village to get high. When authorities show up, it's for their own quick fix: Soldiers and police roll up the sleeves of their dark green uniforms, seemingly oblivious to passers-by.

headline.main: Myanmar Opium Fight Failing; Soldiers Shooting Up
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Opium Fight Failing; Soldiers Shooting Up

docs.snippet: In a March 17 story about political unrest in Venezuela, The Associated Press incorrectly reported the title of student leader Juan Requesens. He is the president of the Federation of University Centers of the Central University of Venezuela, not ...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a March 17 story about political unrest in Venezuela, The Associated Press incorrectly reported the title of student leader Juan Requesens. He is the president of the Federation of University Centers of the Central University of Venezuela, not the president of that university.

docs.snippet: Egypt's crackdown on Islamists has jailed 16,000 people over the past eight months in the country's biggest round-up in nearly two decades, according to previously unreleased figures from security officials. Rights activists say reports of abuses ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Egypt's crackdown on Islamists has jailed 16,000 people over the past eight months in the country's biggest round-up in nearly two decades, according to previously unreleased figures from security officials. Rights activists say reports of abuses in prisons are mounting, with prisoners describing systematic beatings and miserable conditions for dozens packed into tiny cells.

headline.main: Egypt Crackdown Brings Most Arrests in Decades
headline.print_headline: Egypt Crackdown Brings Most Arrests in Decades
